name: Apex
blurb: Charismatic, dangerous, loyal. Eats like a king, fights like a storm.

tiers.title: Road Banter
tiers.notes: Food, jokes, minor rivalry.

tiers.title: Old Scars
tiers.notes: Why he joined the league; fear of being replaced.

tiers.title: The Unspoken Contract
tiers.notes: Hints at Giantkin politics and 'string-pullers'.

nodes.text: Apex spins a coin and asks how you keep your hands steady before a fight.
He rolls back a sleeve, showing old league scars, and asks what you would trade for victory.
He admits the league made him sign an oath he regrets—and hints at who holds the pen.
He repeats the shaman’s blessing with surprising care.

name: Dedor
blurb: Measured voice, sharp eyes. Notices what everyone else avoids.

tiers.title: Campfire Ethics
tiers.notes: He asks what you believe in.

tiers.title: The Map of Consequence
tiers.notes: Reframes choices as debts.

tiers.title: A Secret He Won’t Write Down
tiers.notes: Knows something about the chest.

nodes.text: Dedor asks what you would burn to keep the pilgrims safe.
He sketches a map of debts in the dust, naming the league as the biggest creditor.
He confesses he once worked for the league—just long enough to learn their blind spot.
He quietly recites the blessing like a vow.

name: Theramous
blurb: A calm presence with a habit of being right at the worst possible time.

tiers.title: Tradecraft Talk
tiers.notes: He asks about your craft and listens like it matters.

tiers.title: The League’s Math
tiers.notes: Explains why the league always seems to be ahead of the rumor mill.

tiers.title: A Promise in Ink
tiers.notes: You learn what he’s trying to protect by staying in the party.

nodes.text: Theramous asks about your craft and promises to keep the ledgers straight.
He breaks down the league’s logistics and how to slip between them.
He shows you a promise written in invisible ink—and trusts you with it.

name: Widjet
blurb: A pocketful of springs and wisdom disguised as nonsense.

tiers.title: Gadget Nights
tiers.notes: Shows you a strange hinge-mechanism.

tiers.title: Laughing at Giants
tiers.notes: Explains giant sports rituals with weird accuracy.

tiers.title: Hidden Compartment
tiers.notes: He saw something inside the chest when no one was watching.

nodes.text: Widjet produces a hinge made of three metals and asks which one you’d keep.
He explains a giant sports ritual with unsettling accuracy.
He admits he saw something inside the chest when no one was watching.

name: Jeffery
role: Pilgrim — the only one who can open the chest
blurb: No league ties. Quiet, competent. The key is not metal.

tiers.title: Hands of Ceremony
tiers.notes: Hints at 'opening' as a rite.

tiers.title: The Chest’s True Lock
tiers.notes: A vow. A name. A sacrifice? (kept non-graphic).

tiers.title: Who Sent You?
tiers.notes: He tests whether you’re league-clean or league-tainted.

nodes.text: Jeffery says the chest doesn’t open with force; it opens with permission.
He hints the true lock is a vow, not a key.
He asks who you’d let touch the chest if you never returned.

name: Iria
blurb: Hums when nervous. Knows the old giant words.

tiers.title: Old Hymns
tiers.notes: She teaches you a phrase that means 'safe passage'.

nodes.text: Iria teaches a quiet phrase meaning safe passage.

name: Rook
blurb: Can calm beasts with a look. Keeps the offering secure.

tiers.title: Load & Balance
tiers.notes: He shows you how to shift weight so the cart doesn’t betray you.

nodes.text: Rook shows how to shift weight so the cart never squeals.

tiers.title: Eyes on the League
tiers.notes: She points out the signs of being followed.

nodes.text: Sable points out the signs of being followed.

tiers.title: Hard Terms
tiers.notes: He explains what your coin actually buys.

nodes.text: Brann explains what your coin buys—and what it doesn’t.

tiers.title: Tracks in Snow
tiers.notes: She teaches you to read wind like handwriting.

nodes.text: Mira teaches you to read wind like handwriting.

name: Kest
blurb: Speaks in short sentences; hits in longer distances.

tiers.title: No Heroics
tiers.notes: He warns you about 'league hunters'.

nodes.text: Kest warns you the league’s arrows don’t miss twice.

name: Master Orlan
blurb: A veteran craftsperson who treats wounds like flawed steel.

tiers.title: Lessons Paid in Sweat
tiers.notes: He offers to teach… if you earn it.

nodes.text: Master Orlan critiques your hammer stance and offers a correction.
He teaches a repair trick that saves supplies in a pinch.

text_variants.smith: He nods at your build, then shares a forge trick only smiths should know.

name: Pip
blurb: Wants to see giantland someday. Talks too fast.

tiers.title: Pocket Questions
tiers.notes: Asks you what giants are *really* like.

nodes.text: Pip peppers you with questions about giantland and the chest.

name: Lysa
blurb: Practical kindness. Protects her children with her spine.

tiers.title: Shared Fire
tiers.notes: A small act of care changes the whole mood of camp.

nodes.text: Lysa thanks you for taking her children in and offers to share rations.

name: Nell
blurb: Curious, brave, and not impressed by adults.

tiers.title: Stories for Coins
tiers.notes: She trades local gossip for a bedtime tale.

nodes.text: Nell trades gossip for a bedtime story.

name: Hob
blurb: Quiet until he laughs. Then you remember why you keep walking.

tiers.title: Lucky Charm
tiers.notes: He gives you a trinket 'for the bad nights'.

nodes.text: Hob gives you a lucky trinket for the rough nights.
